I‚Äôve been living like this for a few years. You‚Äôll get used to it. Definitely get a hot plate when you can. I know space and storage can be limited. I use long, flowy table clothes and use storage bins under the table for extra space for these things. The hot plate is pretty essential for this kind of situation, as well as a toaster oven. I only recently got an air fryer and it‚Äôs awesome. I can really easily throw sweet potatoes and veggies in it for a hot meal in 15 minutes.
Thanks, I‚Äôve read a few, but what I was experiencing didn‚Äôt quite seem to fit the description. I‚Äôm sure it was some sort of side effect though.
Thank you!

Thank you! I read this on one of the articles I was perusing the other day in regards to side effects from beginning keto. I‚Äôll definitely add some extra salt to my meals today. The pain is a lot more subdued than it was yesterday/last night luckily!

Thank you! I‚Äôve been vegan for 13 years, vegetarian long before that, so the keto part is the only new thing for me! :] I‚Äôm pretty good at making sure I eat a substantial amount of protein at every meal. Very good insight though, thank you
Thank you! I have some electrolyte tablets at home, I‚Äôll definitely down one in the morning and see if it improves.

You can google eating disorder clinics in your area. They usually offer free diagnosis and consultations. You can inquire about it when you call. Based on your habits, etc. they‚Äôll recommend a level of care for you. You‚Äôre not obligated to accept treatment of any form from them, but you can ask for referrals to specialists in your area. This could get you linked up with a therapist that can help you work through some of your food issues. You could also ask them for other available resources!
I will legit Venmo you milk money.

I‚Äôve /heard/ that weight distribution can definitely do this. Your body is going to want to redeposit fat where it‚Äôs most necessary (around vital organs) before it goes anywhere else. I read about this on some recovery website that noted the initial gain as a potential trigger for people trying to recover from eating disorders. They said that the tummy gains are temporary and fat will begin to deposit more evenly with continued weight gain. It could also be bloat. I ate like shit for 5 days while on vacation and got a noticeable pudge in just my stomach that subsided after I got back on my bullshit.

I would go on the second date first to make sure you‚Äôre both on the same page. You don‚Äôt want to overwhelm her right off the bat.

And then I think those are some really good questions to ask her.

When my boyfriend found out about my eating disorder, he did a little bit of googling. The internet can be especially helpful (as long as they‚Äôre credible websites) in giving you a glimpse into what may be safe/unsafe topics or comments to discus/say to someone with an eating disorder.

For real. I‚Äôve been working hard to not weigh myself frequently at home and the first thing I did  this morning was haul a heavy weighted object to my scale to ensure accuracy before stepping on to see my first thing in the morning, before eating, no clothes on weight.  Much more comforting than the number I saw yesterday, but I‚Äôm still in the middle of my period, so kicking off a poor body image day.

Because I buy my own damn groceries.
Might as well just take that weekly money and throw it directly in the trash. Skip the middle man.
You‚Äôd also be sexier if YOU DIVORCED HIM.
Love it!

I didn‚Äôt do anything fancy. Just followed the recipe and added the extra applesauce in place of the oil. I think the grated zucchini on top of that gets the job done. While mixing, I was a little skeptical because it does turn into one big sticky ball, but once it came out of the oven, it was perfect.
I agree! Easy to manipulate into lower calorie options, as well.

You can bake! I quit for a long time. But I recently started up again, and it can be kind of fun, even if you have a lot of restrictions. Sure, there‚Äôs some recipes I won‚Äôt touch. There‚Äôs just too many fear foods in them, and I can only substitute so much without destroying an entire recipe. But I‚Äôve found quite a few recipes that I can manipulate enough to be comfortable for me, and it‚Äôs also helped me work through some of my fear foods. I‚Äôll really want to make a recipe, and the grocery list seems terrifying and daunting.. so I‚Äôll choose one fear food ingredient to remain on the list, usually the one that I know I can‚Äôt find a work around for. And then I‚Äôm relatively surprised that it doesn‚Äôt actually contribute as negatively to the nutrition of the finished product, as my lizard brain wanted me to believe. I also just feel like baking is one of the only times where I‚Äôm actually /not/ focusing so much on my disorder. I‚Äôm just working on the task at hand and creating something really awesome. I like to work with recipes that freeze well, in case I won‚Äôt finish them, or things that my friends and family might enjoy if I need to get rid of some stuff. I think you should go for it. Even if you just bake for someone else. When you enjoy baking and cooking, it can be really therapeutic. I think you should give it another go.
Lol, dang, give me a second to type it. üòÇ it‚Äôs up for you!

Another Chocolate Covered Katie Recipe for you.. https://chocolatecoveredkatie.com/2015/07/20/zucchini-cake-recipe/ I used the oil-free option by increasing my unsweetened apple sauce. I also wanted more spice to it, so I upped the cinnamon to 1 full teaspoon, as well as added 1/2 a teaspoon of cardamom to the mix. Frosted with erythritol confectioners sugar based cinnamon cream cheese frosting. 5 tablespoons of the confectioners, 6 tablespoons room temp kite hill cream cheese, 2 tablespoons softened vegan butter, and a generous teaspoon of cinnamon. 

Edit: small dash of vanilla extract in the frosting, about a half of a teaspoon.
The. Best. No bones causing friction against my bones, it‚Äôs like having a space heater in bed for my cold, anemic ass. Picks me up like I‚Äôm a damn feather. Best cuddles.

Hmm, it might, but it definitely helps adhere the coconut to the surface while it bakes. I‚Äôm not sure what you could use in its place. You‚Äôll have to let me know how it goes if you try it without! :]
I did use cooking spray, but the dressing called for a couple tablespoons of oil, which I swapped for water :]

I ate a bowl of baby puff finger food in some almond milk, parading as cereal so that I could try the new non dairy Starbucks bottled coffee without going over budget. Pro: Doesn‚Äôt cut the roof of your mouth like regular cereal. Con: You will not be satiated for long. Double Con: the coffee wasn‚Äôt that good. Best meal, also breakfast. Made cinnamon roll baked oatmeal with swerve sweetened cream cheese frosting for under 300 cals and it was divine.
I did not see the original post, so I‚Äôm only commenting based on OPs perspective of the situation.

Doubtful. I‚Äôve lost plenty while guzzling the shit. ü§∑üèº‚Äç‚ôÄÔ∏è I‚Äôm sure it‚Äôs not /great/ for you... but I find it highly unlikely that you would have the same results drinking 3 regular sodas a day vs. 3 diet sodas a day.

Tbh, the accountability helps. My team is really understanding if I fuck up.. and that‚Äôs an important aspect of working through a reliance, and also something you should consider with choosing an accountability buddy. You don‚Äôt want to feel guilty if you mess up, but you do want someone to be able to be like, it‚Äôs okay.. just try again. I started taking it again after my first streak because I just hit a wall. I literally got sent home from work because my coworkers were like ...dude.. you look like shit.. go home and sleep. And then I called out the next day because getting out of bed was just awful. I hate that when I first take a dose I‚Äôm like.. on top of everything... but by the end of the day I‚Äôm sweating, and jittery.. and just feel terrible. It doesn‚Äôt even make sense to do it from a weight loss perspective, because it really doesn‚Äôt aid me in that anymore. I‚Äôve hit a pretty low weight and I just don‚Äôt lose as fast regardless of popping pills, etc. As for appetite suppression, it works, but sometimes I‚Äôll eat anyway just to try and ease my shakiness. And it doesn‚Äôt matter how much water I drink.. the dehydration from those stupid pills gives me the worst Charlie horses. I‚Äôm doing a lot better this week, if that gives you any hope. I still get tired sometimes, but I just try and remind myself that the alternative is a quick boost and then I‚Äôm going to feel just as awful. I try and just drink a green tea or a coffee and power through it.

I second this. The same has happened with me. I just recently hit my ‚Äúone week ephedrine free‚Äù streak for the SECOND time lol. It‚Äôs the number one thing my ED care team has been working on with me, because it makes me feel like shit by the end of the day, but I‚Äôm so worn down otherwise.

BED is just as valid of an eating disorder as any. This is EDAnonymous. Yeah, there‚Äôs a specific sub for BED, but the same goes for AN and BN so I don‚Äôt understand the rationale behind their statement.
Definitely! Already had most of the ingredients laying around!
Half of the coconut topping might be 12 calories... buuut. That cake sure as shit isn‚Äôt. Unless a serving size is like 1/33 of the cake. üôÑ

The only real change I made to this recipe, was omitting the oil in the dressing to cut down the calories, and instead just adding a couple tablespoons of water. It works because obviously, I decided to use it as a salad topping instead of drizzling in a wrap. But beware the dressing is quite spicy. Also, I used regular old cooking spray because your girl is allergic to avocado. The tofu block was cubed into 32 pieces, for four servings of tofu plus three tablespoons of the sauce coming out to about 280 calories, the rest of the cals are in my salad and green onion mix.

https://thefirstmess.com/2019/07/24/crispy-coconut-tofu-lettuce-wraps/#more-11112
It‚Äôs baked in a 10oz ramekin, and fills the container. :]

Hmm, I‚Äôm not sure!! I used to really dislike oatmeal for this reason as well, and I just kind of acquired a taste for it over the last few years with making fancier oatmeals, lol. The top has a nice crust to it, but the inside is still going to have an oatmeal consistency. I think adding things like the PBfit helps it be a little creamier. However, you can try this alternative as well. I‚Äôve made this recipe before and it was really good! I believe I omitted the coconut oil, and I cooked my quinoa in unsweetened vanilla almond milk, instead of water to add to the flavor of it. But this is a French Toast flavored breakfast quinoa and it was very good! I used unsweetened dried cranberries in mine as well, and you couple swap the syrup for a lower calorie version like I did in my baked oatmeal recipe. I believe this recipe made two servings, you‚Äôll have to play around on your calorie tracker to be sure of the calorie count. But it‚Äôs a nice grain breakfast that keeps you full, without the oatmeal texture difficulties. Hope you like it. :]  https://cookieandkate.com/2017/cinnamon-breakfast-quinoa-recipe/

Yeah, I‚Äôve talked to other women about this too. Ravenous hunger. Sometimes I fail to keep it under 1200 during one of the days leading up to my cycle because I hit the, ‚ÄúIDGAF, I‚Äôm eating this full pint of full fat/calories ice cream‚Äù wall. I‚Äôm actually in that week in my cycle now, where I want to eat everything. I just try to eat as much protein as I can in my meals, because it seems to keep me fuller longer. And when I start to feel like I‚Äôm going to have a mental breakdown if I don‚Äôt eat a bag of chocolate chips, I‚Äôve found that a couple of 15 calorie sugar free popsicles will calm the raging sugar beast inside of me for a couple hours. Also. Since I tend to crave really fatty, sweet things, when I‚Äôm premenstrual.. I try to work it into my diet. Like this morning I had baked ‚Äúcinnamon roll‚Äù oatmeal with a little dollop of erythritol sweetened cream cheese frosting on top, and it really did it for me.
Posted!

Calorie count also includes the erythritol brown sugar, pecan chips, and cream cheese frosting on top. The frosting is just 1/2 tablespoon of Daiya cream cheese, swerve confectioners sugar (erythritol), a dash of vanilla extract, and a sprinkle of cinnamon. For the baked oatmeal, set oven to 375¬∞F, you will bake the oatmeal for 15-20 minutes in a 10oz ramekin, then broil on high for 2-3 minutes.  This recipe is a slightly modified Chocolate Covered Katie recipe. 1/2 cup of rolled oats, 1/4 teaspoon vanilla extract, 1/2 teaspoon of cinnamon or more to taste, (CCK posts use 1 1/2 tablespoons of liquid sweetener of choice, such as pure maple syrup), I used 2 tablespoons of sugar free pancake syrup and a pinch of stevia, 1/4 cup unsweetened applesauce, dash of salt, 1 tablespoon PBfit. Mix together, pour into a ramekin sprayed with cooking spray and bake!

Edit: I forgot to add 1/4 cup of unsweetened vanilla almond milk to the recipe above. Don‚Äôt forget that part lol.

I work in a healthcare setting, and there‚Äôs something we call empathy fatigue. It sounds like as a parent, she‚Äôs gone through a lot regarding your disorder. I don‚Äôt think that she doesn‚Äôt care. I think she‚Äôs probably just worn out. My boyfriend has a tendency to get worn out as well. You mentioned having recovery friends and support groups, so for the time being it might be better for you, as well as her, if you share your thoughts/secrets/struggles with them, and let your mom recoup. After some time away from your disorder, she may ask you how it‚Äôs going on her own terms.

Lots of yikes.
When I went home to visit my family, I had just told them about being diagnosed with an ED. My step dad was already speculating based on instagram pictures so I just confirmed it ahead of time to avoid being grilled when I got there. So of course as soon as I walk through the door, I‚Äôm greeted by disapproving and concerned looks from my step father, and then my mom chimes in that I‚Äôm not /that/ skinny, and the recovery center is probably just using me as an easy insurance claim lol. I‚Äôm not underweight, but I‚Äôm close to it, and even now after hashing it out with my mom about how minimizing my disorder is NOT helpful, she still maintains that x amount of pounds over the underweight category is totally fine, and I probably don‚Äôt need as intensive therapy as recommended. But let me tell you, it was suuuuuuuper awkward just standing there for about an eternity with both of my parents studying my body, making comments about my weight, and even arguing with each other about it. I think people who aren‚Äôt stuck in an ED mindset, don‚Äôt really see how much of an impact their comments can make. We‚Äôre getting to a place in society where there‚Äôs more bOdY pOsItIvItY, and women are striving to be ‚Äúthicc AF‚Äù...  So even though your mind immediately takes those kinds of comments and runs with them, most people probably don‚Äôt mean it in a negative way, or mean for it to be perceived in a negative way. It‚Äôs still inconsiderate AF though.

Thank you!!! I‚Äôve definitely had to take school in little chunks here and there, but it really does make me feel much more fulfilled when I‚Äôm in it. I do remind myself that at some point I‚Äôll be able to get back in it. It definitely sucks looking at my bills and being like, this could have paid for a quarter. :,) But I know that at some point I‚Äôll get it done, even if I‚Äôm 40 by the time I get there lol. The drive to do it never really goes away, it‚Äôs just situational.
Thanks for the advice ü•∞

I would put all of this energy towards getting back into school. I had to drop out because of life, but I genuinely love learning, and maybe because I had to wait until a much older age to try and go for my degree, I actually enjoy attending class and other aspects of student life, like studying in the library, etc. I‚Äôve always been academically inclined, and achieved really stellar grades, and a favorable place with most of my professors. I really miss it and wish that I could focus my time and money on that instead of therapy and treatment stuff.

You deserve to be happy.
Kick that dude to the curb!

It‚Äôs ALL of their bars üòê
I figured it out pretty quick, luckily. Someone was kind enough on MFP to type in: (1/2 of the package.) and made me double take. üò¢ those bars aren‚Äôt even good enough to be that calorie dense lol. I may make some myself.
Lemme guess. Natures Bakery.

Sure, just as a little extra motivation, I‚Äôm not sure what you have to be ‚Äúready‚Äù for.  No one in OP makes you /do/ anything. They‚Äôre just there to talk things out with you and offer support. I haven‚Äôt been feeling ready for ANY of this lol. But I find that just taking the steps means that I have the resources available for when I do feel /ready/ for something. Remember, there‚Äôs a little bit of a wait list. So I would hate for you to really need the resources and then be stuck waiting for a phone call for a few weeks just to get to them. Regardless of what you choose, best of luck!!! üòò
Also, they don‚Äôt use weight as a marker for needing help, so throw that out the window. If you‚Äôre experiencing ED behaviors, you qualify. :]

As of right now I‚Äôm doing OP. I would highly recommend them, and they do offer OP for relapse. I would suggest setting up an assessment with them, because there is a bit of a waiting list for OP. It took about a month between my assessment and them being able to set me up with a psych. But they‚Äôre definitely a great place for resources, and I can‚Äôt say enough good things about the people that I‚Äôve worked with there thus far.
Thanks for this! :]

So yeah, I‚Äôm PHP level and they have me in OP right now because of barriers. Same thing. Having trouble with needing PHP but being self reliant, so a lot of it is game planning how I can get into PHP because when it comes down to it, that would benefit me the most. I need more support than OP offers. They‚Äôre still working on my ED, but also being really helpful and trying to help me with insurance, looking at grants, looking for an outside clinic ED therapist for added support if my 90 day OP program ends before I‚Äôm able to get into PHP. 
Definitely give it another try! If you‚Äôre lucky enough to live in a big city like I do, with multiple clinics, try a different clinic. My care team takes on the approach of yeah, I need higher care, like NEED it, but what can they do in the meantime to give me PHP level care and support with the time they have working with me, and get me on track to being more stable to try getting into PHP with everything else I have on my plate, or find the next best option. Recovery shouldn‚Äôt just be an option for those with perfect life circumstances, and I really hope you find a team that realizes that, this time around! 
Also, just going to warn that a lot of RDs won‚Äôt work with someone needing a high level of care if you don‚Äôt already have a psych working with you, because they won‚Äôt, in good consciousness, take your money if they don‚Äôt think it‚Äôll be beneficial for you. Start with a specialized psych, even if it‚Äôs not through a program, you can get a referral list of ED therapists through a recovery center. I would start there! :]
I hope so too!! üíï

Thank you! They‚Äôre definitely working on getting me set up to enter PHP, where I‚Äôm sure challenges will be a little tougher. But in the mean time they‚Äôre definitely doing their best to tackle some of my issues so that I have a better shot when I get there. I‚Äôm very grateful for them!

Thank you üòò
I definitely feel like if someone challenged me in a professional setting, I‚Äôd be like, ‚ÄúCool...watch me not do that then.‚Äù I‚Äôll win any challenge, and by win, I mean waste my time, their time, and get more sick. And I think most specialists understand this, and that‚Äôs why they‚Äôre so willing to be flexible and patient.

Thank you! I actually had my meeting with her today, and these were actually pretty spot on what I presented to her. She already asked me to establish care with a pcp, and I had made that appointment this week for the end of the month, and I wrote down all of the tests she wants run to check for deficiencies And abnormalities. I‚Äôve never been ritualistic about food, but here was what I presented her with:

1. Keep my boyfriend involved with present goals/challenges to help maintain accountability outside of my work in clinic.

2. Gradually reintroduce fear foods.

3. Decrease/eliminate compensation behaviors in relation to food and calories.

4. Be a better caretaker to my body.

She was pretty satisfied with the list. :]

I had this problem. Honestly I just knew that I had enough. I was letting a number dictate how my day was going to go. Or what kind of mood I was going to be in. For me, it came down to pure motivation. Acknowledging that weighing myself so frequently was literally the most detrimental think I was doing to my emotional/mental well being, and wanting to correct that behavior. I honestly just started challenging myself to leave it alone. At first the most I went was a whole day. Then it became 3 day. Etc, etc. now I can go about a week if I need to. If I don‚Äôt think I‚Äôm going to like the number, I don‚Äôt torture myself by looking at it. It took me a few months to get to that point. But it‚Äôs really just a matter of recognizing the impulse, and deciding to try and go against it.
Mine was fresh baked s‚Äômores cookies I made THAT WERE SUPPOSED TO LAST ME ALL WEEK. üò≠

Relapses happen. Don‚Äôt beat yourself up. Just remember that very few people think that they‚Äôre ‚Äúsick enough‚Äù. That‚Äôs such a common feeling. If the professionals are telling you that you do in fact qualify for treatment... trust them. They‚Äôre the ones that know the criteria, they‚Äôre there to tell you that you need the help when your ED voice is telling you that you don‚Äôt. Wishing you the best of luck, no matter what you choose. üíï
Thank you! This was in another ED sub, but makes me wonder if the rules are similar.

Here you go. I use 0 cal sweeteners, unsweetened cacao, and 1 tablespoon of unsweetened applesauce in place of the oil. Sometimes if I‚Äôm feeling fancy, I mix in half a tablespoon of chocolate chips before microwaving. üòé

Sending you all the positive vibes üíúüíúüíúüíúüíú
Get well soon!!!!

First. Remember that most of those kgs are from water retention, so don‚Äôt freak out. As a rule of thumb, I avoid the scale for at least a week if I‚Äôm worried I‚Äôm going to see a lot of water weight in the number. Second. Don‚Äôt over compensate and get extra restricty on yourself. Drink lots of water. Last time I had a lot of retention from eating stuff I don‚Äôt normally eat while on vacation, and I was feeling extra bloaty, someone suggested dandelion tea. It seemed to help a lot. The most important thing is to just get hydrated, don‚Äôt punish yourself, and definitely don‚Äôt beat yourself up over it.

I‚Äôm vegan, so all of my recipes are of that variety. However. Cookies are especially hard to keep the calorie count down because they use a lot of butter. I find that‚Äôs where all the calories come from, even when using sugar replacement like swerve. If you are just dyyying for cookies, and that‚Äôs what you want/need. I suggest just making a normal recipe, and cutting down part of the calories using swerve sugar replacement. You can find it at most Whole Foods stores, or check the website for the store locator. Call ahead though, because I found that it can be misleading. They have 0 cal brown sugar which will be relatively handy for cookie baking. Honestly though, I‚Äôve found the easiest way to get a dessert fix while keeping it low cal is just making a mug cake with the replacements. Under 200 calories for a decent sized treat. Otherwise, you‚Äôre just going to have to tweak a recipe and still focus heavily on portion control.
I can second this, I have some of the almond turmeric in my fridge and it‚Äôs quite good :]

I‚Äôve been really digging this recipe:
2 tablespoons of miso paste
3 tablespoons of rice vinegar 
Teeny dash of sesame oil
1/2 tablespoon fresh grated ginger
And a few dashes of garlic powder, onion powder, and black pepper.
Then just water to desired consistency. I like mine a little thinner so it comes out to around 35 cals for 2-3 tablespoons worth.

If you don‚Äôt know this person, personally. Leave them alone. You don‚Äôt know if they‚Äôre already seeking treatment. I‚Äôm sure the people who are close to them, and know them, can intervene. It‚Äôs nice that you‚Äôre concerned and you want to do the right thing. But if someone I wasn‚Äôt comfortable with approached me about my weight, I would be pretty taken aback.

I feel this so hard. I pee nonstop from whatever it is that day. EC, diet drinks, tons of water, etc. etc. I‚Äôm sure the people at work (medical field) think something is severely wrong with me. ‚òπÔ∏è

So is raging alcoholism. Makes you nice and bloated. Also says the person who is spending so much of their time and energy continuing this conversation. You seem really triggered, and at this point this is really just entertaining for me.
Cool story. Again. Good luck on your next recovery. Should be a breeze this time around.

I‚Äôm referring to when you ‚Äúagreed that daily would be better‚Äù I don‚Äôt give af what you find agreeable. You‚Äôre not part of the equation here. Good luck with your recovery as well, back at you.

No, because you‚Äôre making actual treatment recommendations when you‚Äôre not part of my treatment team. Your pursuit to be right about something has gone completely off topic, which was asking for help in goal development. General goal development. And in the process, making (me), the OP, even more apprehensive about recovery. That‚Äôs what you‚Äôve achieved here.
Cool story bro. You‚Äôre not helping.

Well thank god you‚Äôre not my RD then, and hopefully she doesn‚Äôt share that sentiment. Because to me, it‚Äôs like being asked to jump into the deep end without knowing how to swim. The result is drowning. You need to start in shallow water before taking on the bigger challenge. For me, drowning is an absolute mental breakdown and withdrawing from treatment entirely. I need to be able to be comfortable with the skills before submerging myself in harder tasks. And I beg to differ that it‚Äôs like drug addiction. You need food to live, you don‚Äôt need drugs to live. You don‚Äôt learn how to coexist with your drug addiction, but you do learn how to coexist with your food triggers.
